summary: Email chain between FBI agents, a detective, and a UK lawyer (Jill Greenfield) regarding arranging an interview with Greenfield's client, a victim of sexual assault in the UK, as part of the Epstein investigation. The correspondence discusses scheduling a call and confirming the client's date of birth to determine her age at relevant times.

persons.name: Jill Greenfield
persons.role: Partner at Fieldfisher law firm, attorney for a victim/client
persons.context: UK lawyer representing a client who is a victim of sexual assault in the UK; she is coordinating with US investigators to arrange an interview for her client in London, while asserting the client's right to anonymity under UK law.

persons.name: N. (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: FBI agent based in New York who is part of the email chain discussing the Epstein investigation and coordination with Jill Greenfield regarding interviewing her client.

persons.name: W. (NY) (oGA)
persons.role: Detective with NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: Addressed in the initial email from Jill Greenfield regarding the Epstein investigation; appears to be a point of contact for arranging the victim interview.

connections.description: Communicating to arrange an interview with Greenfield's client for the Epstein investigation.
Initial contact by Greenfield to the detective regarding the Epstein investigation and setting up a victim interview.
Greenfield is the legal representative for a victim of sexual assault in the UK who is relevant to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Initial contact from Jill Greenfield
events.description: UK lawyer Jill Greenfield emails Detective W. (NY) (oGA) to discuss arranging an interview with her client, a victim of sexual assault in the UK, for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Scheduling coordination for victim interview call
events.description: Email chain discusses scheduling a call between investigators and Jill Greenfield to hash out details for interviewing her client, including determining the client's date of birth.

locations: Riverbank House, 2 Swan Lane, London EC4R 3TT (Fieldfisher office)
New York, NY (implied base for FBI/NYPD task force)
keyFacts: A UK-based victim of sexual assault, represented by lawyer Jill Greenfield, is being sought for an interview by US investigators (NYPD/FBI task force) regarding the Epstein investigation.
The victim is entitled to automatic anonymity under UK Statute as a victim of sexual assault that occurred in the UK, and her lawyer states she does not waive that right.
Investigators need the victim's date of birth to determine how old she was at the relevant times of the alleged offenses.
The correspondence shows active coordination between US law enforcement and UK legal counsel in early 2020 to gather victim testimony in the Epstein case.
The document references the 'NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force' as involved in the investigation.
